content.description: Bring your face climbing skills for this route.

This is a route my wife and I did to stay in the sun. I believe it is on the sunshine wall, but it is deffinately not next to the other routes. The first short pitch is the money. Varied face climbing protected by some good gear. The second pitch is maybe 5.7 a bit more run out. Fun, but not as good as the first pitch. It is more of a enjoyable summit pitch. I believe it is around the corner from around the sunshine wall route on the same piece of rock. If I am wrong about that please comment so I can fix it. Also, if someone knows an  FAist let me know. I assume someone else has climbed it before.
content.protection: Single rack. Belay at tree on pitch 1 and sling blocks on top.
content.location: Around the arete (west) from the sunshine wall.

climbs.name: Rocket Sled
climbs.fa: Diane Fisher, John Frank, Chris Mohr 1986

content.description: Don't fall or you will deck.
Climbs on the face with a few placements.
content.protection: Hard to find good gear.  Look close.

content.description: This is the headwall above Setting Sun. After the approach 5 easy or 4th class slabs above Setting Sun, climb on good edges into a shady corner of 5.8. After topping out the corner a sloped ledge and long reach to the final cracks makes the crux (one hard 5.9 or easy 5.10 move). The rest of the climb is made of big reaches on good holds and jams on vertical quartzite and granite!
content.protection: Single rack to a size 3 BD and stoppers.
content.location: The headwall above Setting Sun (close to the sunshine wall).

content.description: This low-angle broken wall opposite the Leaning Tower. Excellent for learning the finer points of slab climbing.  Routes from 5-easy to 5.10d make this a good winter wall to warm up on. No anchors for any of the climbs.
